description: From Hebrew חַלָּה‎ (ḥallá, “loaf”), influenced by Yiddish חלה‎ (khale).

nouns.description: challah (countable and uncountable, plural challahs or challos or challot or challoth)

entries.meaning: (countable) A traditional bread eaten by Ashkenazi Jews, usually braided for the Sabbath and round for a yom tov.
examples: […] it is a time-honored custom that when women bake challah-loaves for Sabbath and Yom Tov use, they specifically prepare a dough large enough to be obligated in challah, so they can fulfill the mitzvah of separating challah […] .

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The commandment to separate a portion of bread or bread dough for the cohanim (Numbers 15:17–21); in contemporary practice, the portion is burned until inedible.
(countable) The portion separated in fulfillment of the above.
